contextId.information: God speaks of Israel worshiping many idols as being like a woman having sex with many men. AT: "You have given your love and trust to idols the way a prostitute gives her body to men not her husband" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: You have lived as a prostitute who has many lovers

contextId.information: These two sentences have similar meanings. The second one strengthens the thought in the first. (See" Parallelism) AT: "The enemy army is destructive like a strong wind storm" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: See, he is attacking like clouds, and his chariots are like a storm

contextId.information: AT: "they will lay siege all around the city" (See: [[:en:obe:other:siege]]) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: They will be like the watchmen of a cultivated field against her all around

contextId.information: The arrows that come from the quiver kill very many people and send them to their grave. AT: "That nation will use arrow to kill very many people." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: Its quiver is like an open tomb

contextId.information: A well is supposed to keep producing water. Like a well remains with its water, Jerusalem has remained with its wickedness, even when Yahweh punishes it. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_irony]])
contextId.quote: Just as a well keeps giving water, so this city keeps producing wickedness

contextId.information: AT: "The sound that they make is a loud roar like the sound of the ocean." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: Their sound is like the sea roar

contextId.information: "a person who will test my people." Yahweh is comparing Jeremiah to a person who tests silver to find out how pure it is. The people are like the silver that Jeremiah is testing and their sins are the impurities in the silver. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: one who tests my people like one would test metal

contextId.information: The bones are compared to dung on the ground both to emphasize that they will be disgusting and because they will not be buried. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: They will be like dung on the surface of the earth

contextId.information: "dead bodies will drop everywhere like animal poop drops all over the fields." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: corpses of men will fall like dung in the fields

contextId.information: "I will scatter them like chaff that is blown away by them wind." Yahweh is saying He will scatter His people throughout the world just as chaff is scattered by the wind. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: I will scatter them like chaff that perishes in the desert wind

contextId.information: This speaks of the donkey panting because they are thirsty by saying that they pant like jackals. Jackals are fiece wild dog which pant a lot. AT: "they pant in the wind like thirsty jackals" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: they pant in the wind like jackals

contextId.information: Yahweh compares Jeremiah to a wall because the people will not be able to defeat him. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]]
contextId.quote: like an impenetrable bronze wall to this people

contextId.information: The sons and daughters born in the land are compared to dung on the ground both to emphasize that they will be disgusting and because they will not be buried. See how you translated a similar phrase in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:08:01|8:2]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: They will be like dung on the ground

contextId.information: The person who trusts in Yahweh will always prosper, just like a tree does when it is planted by a river. It is not affected when there is no rain. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: he will be like a plant beside waters

contextId.information: This phrase repeats what was implicit in the previous phrase in the form of a simile. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: Like clay in a potter's handâ€”that is how you are in my hand

contextId.information: Yahweh compares himself to wind from the east that scatters dust and debris. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: I will scatter them before their enemies like an eastern wind

contextId.information: "They became very evil" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: All of them have become like Sodom ... like Gomorrah.

contextId.information: This expression compares bad figs to bad people. Bad figs are figs which cannot be eaten and are useless, bad people do not follow Yahweh and are also useless. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: But like the bad figs that are too bad to be eaten

contextId.information: Possible meanings are 1) there were few or no people left to bury those whom Yahweh had killed or 2) there was a total lack of concern for the bodies of the dead. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: They will be like dung on the ground

contextId.information: Unlike other references where God is viewed as a protective lion toward Israel, in this passage God acts like a lion in order to punish Israel. AT: "Yahweh is coming like a young lion to make the people's land a horror" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: Like a young lion, he has left his den, for their land will become a horror

contextId.information: No one can count the stars in the sky or the sand on the seashore, and no one will be able to count the descendants of David and Levi who serve Yahweh. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: As the hosts of heaven cannot be counted, and as the sand of the seashores cannot be measured, so I will increase the descendants of David my servant and the Levites who serve before me

contextId.information: Taking or destroying everything in Egypt is compared to how a shepherd carefully cleans off his clothes. AT: "He will take or destroy everything valuable in Egypt just as a shepherd is careful to get every insect off of his clothes" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: He will clean out the land of Egypt just as shepherds clean vermin off their clothes

contextId.information: The people who escape the destruction in the city are compared to a bush which survives the harsh conditions in the desert and has green leaves all year. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: become like a juniper bush

contextId.information: Jeremiah was comparing his feeling to a sad song. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: my heart is lamenting for Moab like a flute

contextId.information: This is another way of saying that the attack will be fierce and unexpected. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: like a lion

contextId.information: The attack will be vicious and unexpected. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: attack like an eagle, and swoop down and spread his wings

contextId.information: This compares their happiness to the happiness of stallions that are neighing - making loud noises. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: you neigh like a powerful horse

contextId.information: AT "pile up what is left of her the way heaps of grain are piled up" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: pile her up like heaps of grain

contextId.information: This is another way of saying that the attack will be fierce and unexpected. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: like a lion

contextId.information: Yahweh compares a great number of horses to a swarm of locusts. AT: "bring many horses with soldiers quickly." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: bring up horses like swarming locusts

contextId.information: AT: "Babylon will disappear as this stone disappeared." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: Babylon will sink like this
